alert.note: Alert for Dundy; Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 9:16AM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Flooding threat continues through tonight... .Several more rounds of rainfall are expected today through tonight. The final round of rain tonight will be the greatest concern for flash flooding. Soils are already saturated, or nearly so. This will cause flash flooding to occur more easily with any additional rainfall that occurs. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of Colorado, Kansas, and southwest Nebraska, including the following areas, in Colorado, Cheyenne, Kit Carson, and Yuma. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Decatur, Gove, Graham, Logan, Norton, Rawlins, Sheridan, Sherman, Thomas, and Wallace. In southwest Nebraska, Dundy, Hitchcock, and Red Willow. * Through late tonight * WHEN...From 6 AM MDT /7 AM CDT/ Thursday through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
